key_channel_insights.line_content: Parity still leads (67.8%) but fell 4 ppts WoW; discounts (16.1%) and premiums (14.3%) are now equally likely, exposing margin on both sides.
MSE priced below saudia.com on 95.6% of itineraries at an average –11 % gap; parity is inching up but remains immaterial (4.2%).
GDS holds 68.6% parity, yet 15.7% of fares carry a 9 % premium while 12.2% sit –8 % lower, driven largely by Saudi-origin and close-in sales.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: 67.8% of OTA itineraries matched website pricing, but parity slipped 4 ppts WoW as both discounts and premiums rose.
When mis-aligned, OTAs were 7 % cheaper in 16.1% of cases and 8 % higher in 14.3%, creating symmetrical exposure.
Long-haul parity improved to 74.5% (+5 ppts), whereas short-haul parity fell to 67.3% (–5 ppts) amid greater undercutting.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Only 1.8% of OD pairs lacked an OTA offer – operationally negligible.
Parity at 67.8% is down 4.3 ppts WoW and 2.7 ppts MoM, signalling dilution.
Discount share rose to 16.1% (+2 ppts WoW); average savings hold at 7 %.
Premium cases increased to 14.3% (+2 ppts WoW) with an 8 % average uplift.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Parity 67.3% (–5 ppts); both discounts (16.7%) and premiums (14.3%) rose ~2 ppts.
Parity 74.5% (+5 ppts); OTA-lower share dropped to 8.3% while premiums held ~14.5%.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Parity slid to 68.3% (–5.3 ppts); premiums (15.9%) now edge discounts (14.2%).
Parity nudged up to 64.9%; discounts remain high at 27.5%, premiums minimal at 5%.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Parity fell to 65.5% (–7 ppts); both discounts (17.5%) and premiums (14.3%) expanded.
Parity stable at 72.2%; discounts eased to 13.3% while premiums held ~14.5%.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE undercut the website on 95.6% of ODs last week at –11 % avg gap.
Exact-match pricing doubled WoW to 4.2% but remains negligible.
Zero instances of MSE pricing above the website across all datasets.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Comparable fare missing on just 0.19% of ODs; coverage stable.
Parity rose 2.3 ppts WoW but leakage risk stays high.
Channel-lower share slipped 2.3 ppts yet still dominates at a –10 % average.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 94.4% lower with –10 % gap; parity +0.7 ppts WoW.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 97.0% undercut; parity only 3.0%, both steady week-to-week.

gds_highlights.line_content: 69% of itineraries matched website price, down 5 ppts WoW.
When different, 16% were higher vs 12% lower; gaps ±8-9 %.
Saudi origins and last-minute sales drive most discrepancies; non-SA runs 83% parity.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Offer absence stable WoW, improved vs last month.
High but slipped 4.6 ppts WoW, reversing previous gains.
Premium share up 1.6 ppts WoW at +9 % average uplift.
Discount share up 2.8 ppts WoW but still below last month.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Parity 68.6% (–5 ppts); both premiums and discounts increased.
Parity 68.8% (+4.2 ppts); both premiums (14.6%) and discounts (7.6%) contracted.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Parity strong at 82.9%; discounts minimal (2%), premiums 14.1%.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Parity steadier at 70.3%; premiums 15%, discounts 9% with little change.
